title: Nithya Raman
added: Raman came under fire for vitriolic behavior in her City Council campaign, after telling supporters "I want you to get angry" at a February campaign rally.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.losfelizledger.com/internet-vitriol-taints-local-city-council-race/|title=Internet Vitriol Taints Local City Council Race|date=October 15, 2020}}</ref> In March, an organization which endorsed Nithya Raman doxed opponent David Ryu by publishing his home address on Twitter, in violation of Twitter rules and California State cyberstalking laws. The tweets were removed, but not before threats were made against Ryu.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.losfelizledger.com/internet-vitriol-taints-local-city-council-race/|title=Internet Vitriol Taints Local City Council Race|date=October 15, 2020}}</ref>

Raman has said she envisions a "much smaller" armed police force in Los Angeles, but has declined to state specifics.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nithyaforthecity.com/transforming-public-safety|title=A NEW APPROACH TO PUBLIC SAFETY IN LA|}}</ref> On July 3, 2020, she signed a pledge<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/nithyavraman/status/1279153187677548544?s=20|}}</ref> to adopt a proposed budget that would reduce the Los Angeles Police Department budget by 98%, but has since clarified that pledge. Organizations which have endorsed Raman, including the Democratic Socialists of America, Los Angeles, have stated their goal is to abolish the police force in Los Angeles, telling the Los Angeles Times in an October 2020 article they support Raman and other "like-minded people" to achieve this goal.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-10-21/la-city-council-race-abolish-police-ryu-raman|title=L.A.'s Ryu-Raman council race reflects wider battle over policing among Democrats and the left Race|date=October 21, 2020}}</ref>

title: Nithya Raman
added: In the March 3, 2020 primary, Raman faced incumbent [[David Ryu]] and screenwriter Sarah Kate Levy.<ref>[https://www.losfelizledger.com/whos-running-against-david-ryu-profile-on-challenger-sarah-kate-levy/ Los Feliz Ledger - "Who's Running Against David Ryu? Profile on Challenger Sarah Kate Levy"]</ref> Ryu received 32,298 votes (44.4%), Raman received 31,502 votes (40.8%), and Sarah Kate Levy received 10,860 votes (14.1%).<ref>{{cite web |title=Official LA County vote tally |url=https://www.lavote.net/docs/rrcc/svc/4085_FINAL_SVC_Precinct_ZBC.pdf |website=Los Angeles County Registrar-Recorder / County Clerk |accessdate=29 October 2020}}</ref> Because no candidate received over fifty percent of the vote, Raman and Ryu advanced to the runoff election, scheduled for November 3, 2020.
